I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** Users on M3 Macs are experiencing issues with PiecesOS running in "basic mode due to device constraints," which is preventing them from accessing full functionality, including the "Workstream Activity" view and LTM engine activity updates.

**Key Points:**

* The issue appears to be related to the vector search support on M3 Macs.
* Closing and reopening PiecesOS temporarily resolves the issue for some users.
* There is confusion about the "basic mode" and its implications.

**Solutions:**

* A fix is planned for the next version of PiecesOS.
* In the meantime, restarting PiecesOS can resolve the issue for some users.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is ongoing and under investigation.
* A fix is expected in the next version of PiecesOS.

**Outcome:**

* The issue is expected to be resolved with the next version of PiecesOS.
* Users should continue to check for updates and restart PiecesOS as needed until the fix is released.

**Additional Notes:**

* Some users are also experiencing issues with the "Workstream Activity" view and LTM engine activity updates even after restarting PiecesOS.
* The origin of the "unknown origin" element version 1.0.10 is unclear and may be related to the issue.

This summary focuses on the most important details of the conversation and provides a clear understanding of the current situation and the expected resolution. It also highlights areas where further information is needed or where additional investigation is necessary.

Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Performance Issues with Copilot

**Key Points Raised:**

* Copilot performance is significantly slower than before.
* Hard-resetting the active runtime does not improve performance.
* High CPU usage and blocked responses are observed.
* Context files are not being read.
* The problem happens even after installing the latest updates (Pieces OS 10.0.3 and Desktop app 3.0.2).

**Problems Identified:**

* Bug in the copilot experience related to clicking "Hard-Reset Active Runtime."
* A value was not being reset properly, preventing the websocket from re-initializing correctly.
* Performance issues persist even after the latest updates.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A fix was implemented and released in version 3.1.0 of the Desktop app to improve performance.
* Scheduling a real-time chat to investigate individual issues further.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The latest update (version 3.1.0) should address the copilot performance issue 
 for most users.
* Some users may still experience lagging issues, and a real-time investigation is scheduled to address these specific cases. For those users, the problem is not consistently resolved.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: **Key Points:** * Pieces OS port is not fixed, it can be changed by the user. * The extension checks expected ports to find the active one and ensure Pieces OS api is running. * These checks are only made against the Pieces OS endpoint and don't scan for anything else. * The checks cause errors to appear in the dev console, cluttering it. **Problems:** * Unwanted errors flooding the dev console due to port checks. * Difficulty in differentiating real errors from phantom errors. **Solutions:** * **Proposed:** Hide or handle errors from inactive port checks to reduce console clutter. * **Implemented:** Fixed in the recent web extension update (version 4.0.4). * **Workaround:** Users can hide network messages in dev console settings. **Current Status:** * Issue fixed with the latest web extension update. **Outcome:** * Cleans the dev console by preventing unnecessary error messages. * Improves user experience and development workflow. * Users can now easily identify real errors from phantom ones.

related_issues.text:
Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
### Checked for Existing Issues?

Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

With Pieces Extension installed in Visual studio 2022, SQL database field is not editable (not clickable?)

Reproduce: 
- Connect to any SQL server with some table, choose a table and right click -> View Data
- Try edit the database's table field (the field will be unable to focus, so unable to edit)

* SQL database is editable again after disable pieces extension and restart VS.
* Try turn off everything in the extension's UserPreference did not work.
* While you can not edit a field, but delete a row is possible (so maybe some UI conflict?)

Here are some picture

Without the extension: the edit cursor shown up when click on field
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c45dbafe-29c7-4acd-9827-b34cd0cd76f7)

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Investigation into the root cause of the issue is ongoing. 

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue remains open and under investigation.
* No workaround or solution is currently available.

* Continue investigating the cause of the issue.

There's no opportunity for the User to choose where the Pieces OS is installed or where any data that's collected is stored. From Windows 10 onwards there is a system feature to set where new content is to be stored by default. This is in Settings/System/Storage.

Pieces stuck on 70% CPU on one processor interfering with other keyboard chain handlers. System became unresponsive
### Checked for Existing Issues?

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Current

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

A specific keyboard chain handler that was affected and incapacitated was zvirtualDesktop which has been in use for several years and behaves well with other handlers.

Eventually I was able to kill the Pieces OS instance but as I didn''t know what, if any, other effects there had been I restarted the machine. In logging in the MS new machine set of dialogs started, it evidently believed that this was the first run. I restarted again and so far the machine is working normally.

I uninstalled the Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop before the initial reboot. It's possible there was a dirty Registry on the first restart as it was a warm restart.

I do not believe that this product is suitable for public use without a considerable warning that there may be trouble ahead. As it is I don't think it's a product ready for market given the other points I've observed, (the inability to install it to other than the boot drive, the lack of information or control of where data is stored and so on.
